meanings.definition: To surpass in points or score.
meanings.sent1: She managed to outpoint her opponent in the final round.
meanings.sent2: The team needed to outpoint their rivals to win the championship.
meanings.sent3: In a surprising turn of events, the underdog managed to outpoint the reigning champion.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication and hard work allowed her to outpoint all her competitors.
meanings.sent5: The student's strategy to outpoint the others in the quiz paid off with a perfect score.

meanings.definition: To outdo or outperform in a competition.
meanings.sent1: The athlete was determined to outpoint his previous record in the race.
meanings.sent2: She always manages to outpoint her colleagues in sales every month.
meanings.sent3: The siblings playfully tried to outpoint each other in a game of chess.
meanings.sent4: His creativity and innovation helped him outpoint the other candidates in the job interview.
meanings.sent5: The magician's performance was so captivating that it outpointed all the others at the talent show.
